1: One day, Hare was out looking for food. He met Elephant, who had a pot of honey. Hare asked Elephant, "Please be kind and carry me. I am weak."
2: Elephant agreed to carry Hare.  Hare got onto Elephant’s back and held on tightly. He started eating Elephant’s honey straight away!
3: Honey began dripping on Elephant’s back.  When Elephant asked what it was, Hare said that it was from his wound.
4: They reached a river and found a large buffalo drinking water.
5: Hare wanted to know who was stronger, Buffalo or Elephant.
6: They began arguing.  Elephant said she was stronger and Buffalo said she was stronger.
7: Hare said he had an idea how to find out who was stronger. He asked them to wait for him there.
8: Hare came back with a long rope. He tied the one end around Elephant’s waist and led her away from the river.
9: Hare tied the other end of the rope around Buffalo’s waist and left her near the river.
10: Hare ran and hid himself in a tree. He shouted, "Ready! One, two, three! Pull!"
11: Buffalo and Elephant pulled. Elephant pulled Buffalo.
12: Buffalo pulled Elephant. Neither could win.
13: From where he was hiding, Hare continued to eat Elephant’s honey.
14: After he had finished the honey, he cut the rope closer to Buffalo.
15: Elephant fell over hard and hit a tree.
16: Hare went to Buffalo and praised her, saying that she was stronger.
